column4: Ah.  Is there any way to get to 1024x768?  I've used that resolution with the same hardware under FC2, so it's not going to make the monitor explode or anything.  :-)
run: sudo dpkg-reconfigure xerver-xfree86 in a console
take all default answers and just adjust the resolution if you come to this
I went through the configuration, but it showed 1024x768 already enabled (/etc/X11/XFree86-4 indicates the same).  Yet, I still can't get the display set to that resolution.
don't you have 1024x786 in the resolution tool (Computer->System Tools->Screen Resolution (guessed, it's german here))
sounds like your display isn't detected correctly.....the HorizSync and VertRefresh seem wrong, there is a tool to check these values, but i don't remember the name
That's the weid thing... all of the information is dead on accurate.
if 1024 is in the Modelines in you XF86Config but not in the resolution tool thats really weird
if you are sure the monitor values are actually correct, you should file a bug report
Nope.  It's an old integrated Rage Pro card.  I think it's 4 or 6MB or so.
llyama is the monitor company the bugreport i pointed to is about
if you don't like bugzilla youll probably like to send a mail with your prob to ubuntu-users@lists.ubuntu.com to nail this one down with a X developer
